item.title: Kristine add a quote by Salman Rushdie
item.description:
"When a reader falls in love with a book, it leaves its essence inside him, like radioactive fallout in an arable field, and after that there are certain crops that will no longer grow in him, while other, stranger, more fantastic growths may occasionally be produced."
[<i>Books vs. Goons</i>, L.A. Times, April 24, 2005]" -- Salman Rushdie

item.title: Kristine add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "I do things like get in a taxi and say, "The library, and step on it." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: Kristine add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "We pass for what we are." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Kristine add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "My book should smell of pines and resound with the hum of insects." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Kristine add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "A book must be the axe for the frozen sea within us." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Kristine add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "Be like the bird who, pausing in her flight awhile on boughs too slight, feels them give way beneath her, and yet sings, knowing she hath wings." -- Victor Hugo
